name: The Lakes Cairns Resort & Spa

reviews.text: This resort is very family orientated, with lovely, clean, spacious apartments and excellent swimming pools.
reviews.title: Very family orientated - no nightlife!
A little piece of paradise
reviews.text: However - everything closes at 9:30 - 10 pm!! The bar and restaurant shut down and the resort is like a morgue! You can get a taxi into Cairns (about $30 return ) but sometimes all you want after a long day out on the reef or the rainforest is a nice drink and chat at the bar on your complex and that is one thing that is sadly lacking at the Lakes Resort.

When we asked why everything closed so early ,we were told it was because some of the apartments were residential and the resident's committee didn't want noise!! I hasten to add I am a 50 year old woman not given to raging the night away but just wanting a glass of wine with friends before going to bed at about 11:30 pm - not much to ask for on holiday is it?
reviews.title: Great family accommodation

likes.disliked: — distance from the centre of town

reviews.text: So - if you do like a little drink of a night while on holiday - think carefully before booking the Lakes Resort. If you have young kids who need to be in bed early and you are happy to go to bed at 10 pm yourself, then this place will be ideal for you as the grounds, apartments and pools are really lovely and it's a safe environment for the children.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time at the Lakes

reviews.text: We stayed during the school holidays. My sister and girls stayed at the same complex. It was a relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable experience. The apartment was spotless located on the 2nd floor. My sister had a ground floor apartment...........Honestly we were really impressed. It is security gated and completely safe. There is a selection of pools to choose from. Very minor points that did not detract from the experience were the restuarant wasn't the greatest when it comes to food, the female receptionist was a little dismissive.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The reviews here (up to Aug 30) were one of the main reasons why we selected our 7 night stay at the Lakes Resort. We are a family of four (18 month & 5 year old) and we stayed there early September 2007.
reviews.title: Great Family Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the resort to be a great place for families; especially those with younger children. I say this this for a few reasons:
reviews.title: Horrible Experience at this Not-so-Resort

likes.liked: — Nothing worth recommending or enough to counteract all the negatives

reviews.text: 1. cot, high-chair, even car booster seat availability
reviews.title: holiday village

likes.disliked: — out of the way and air traffic noise

reviews.text: 2. I believe 3 of the 7 pool areas had sections with sand and the accompanying shallow level. This allowed our youngest to wade out a little.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — Basic, cold pools, not enough sunbeds and THE AIRCRAFT NOISE!!

reviews.text: 3. Some apartments have DVD players, but need to be equested when booking.
reviews.title: Biodome

likes.disliked: — location, jet noise, cheesy internet, too much money for transportatiion to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place. Apartments fully equiped with everything you need. We didnt find the planes a nuisance, the atmosphere was relaxing. Choice of 4 pools to choose from. Clean & plenty of sunloungers. Supermarket on the complex not great but hotel bus available to take you to the shopping malls. Restaurants on the complex good. We stayed for 3 nights but didnt want to leave. We used the hotels website to book a car to collect us from the airport, the driver was there waiting for us.
reviews.title: Relaxing place to stay

reviews.text: Excellent resort - we visited with friends for their honeymoon & it was booked for us. I was a little worried reading some reviews about resort noise, aircraft noise etc. OK, some planes fly over during the daytime. But they are not that noisy & most of the people complaining about them presumably flew into Cairns on a plane! The resort is near the centre, so it is also near the airport making for very short & pleasant transfer times! We had a room opposite the bistro bar & were never disturbed by any noise from that. The resort itself is amazing - beautiful pools & so clean & perfectly maintained. There are a couple of blocks with no lift, so I would suggest contacting them prior to arrival if that would bother you. We had staff take our luggage to our room & back to reception when we left, even though we had a lift. The reception staff could not have been more helpful, calling to book trips for us from our brochures, advising us (very accurately!) on the best days for snorkelling due to the weather conditions - we arrived at the end of a cyclone. You get options of daily or weekly cleaning - we only wanted weekly but had daily charged by mistake but it was very easily resolved. The restaurant food & wine was excellent quality & the courtesy bus into Cairns was efficient. It's not a very long walk, maybe 20-30 mins, but you wouldn't get a resort that size with all the pools etc right in the centre. Taxis we found were very cheap (approx A$12) & reception will book those for you, also easy to find in town to get back again. Great pool & beach areas for kids, would be better if there were a few more sun loungers. If elderly, not sure how you would climb from one pool area to another. But we loved it!
reviews.title: Loved the Lakes

likes.liked: — High standard, well equipped, great location, amazing pools

reviews.text: Stayed here for 10 days over xmas with the family had fab time.2 bed apartment nice and clean and spacious.Secure site and kept clean.True pool closes at 10pm and very quite after that GREAT!!!! If you require some entertainment head for the town centre plenty of shops,bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice pool

likes.disliked: — If you want to be picky,close to a airport so expect to see and hear the odd plane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was amazing, the resort was excellent and rooms were very very big. We had a one bedroom appartment and it was huge. The resturant and bars were very nice and the 4 swimming pools are lovely. The staff are very helpful and friendley. I would definatley return to this place. Very impressed.
reviews.title: Loved it !!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked this through expedia and we paid over £80 a night for it so we were expecting a good service as we booked for 10 nights. when we arrived we were told we are too ealr for check in, it was 13:20! We had just flown from Sydney and were tired so thanks!
reviews.title: Planes flying over every day, nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: anyway, we got to the room and we had a 1 bedroom apartment. it overlooked the century lakes behind the hotel, which was pretty scary as there is alot of wild crocs there and the noises at nighttime and pretty damm scary!
reviews.title: Pretty resort but not much else!

likes.disliked: — Location, customer service, extra charges for everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lakes for 7 nights and found the room to be clean and well equipped with everything we needed and expected from apartment accommodation. The 1 bedroom apartment included a small, 1 person spa bath. Some of the balconies overlook neighbouring streets and a construction site, not the most picturesque view but the street was relatively quiet as was the construction site. Rooms had ceiling fans and air conditioning, but we found we didn't need the air conditioner at all as the ceiling fans created adequate air flow. Our apartment was on the 3rd level and was only accessible by stairs, don't think there were any elevators in the resort. A little tricky to negotiate a heavy suitcase up and down the stair case.
reviews.title: Clean & well maintained
Underwhelming!
reviews.text: We had breakfast at the onsite restaurant Rambutan but found the menu to be rather pricey for what was offered, recommend preparing your own breakfast in apartment and enjoying it on your private balcony! The resort store doesn't sell a wide variety of items, so best to catch the shuttle bus into the woolworths in town or walk to the IGA a few blocks away.

I was aware that it was away from the centre but previous reviewees had said it was a 20 min walk into Cairns (perhaps it is to some shops) but if you wish to go along the Esplanade/ waters edge it's about 4 kms to the centre area, it is an easy walk but I did feel on the outer + the restaurants/cafe at the lakes are pretty average. The buffet breakfast was good value with the 2 for 1 voucher but struggling to meet 4 star standard.
reviews.title: Nice yet a little too removed

reviews.text: * There is a good fish shop, where you can get fish and chips or wet fish on the cnr of captain cook hwy and greenslopes st*
reviews.title: A unique village experience

likes.disliked: — Distance from Cairns beaches and town

reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: Good: direct line to cab company. Restaurants (make reservations for dinner). Guest lounge for early arrivals and later departures. Beds. Washer and Dryer.

So So: Whoever said that you can not hear the planes taking off from the airport must have been hard of hearing. Planes start taking off at 05:30. They have 2 pick up/drop off points for day tours depending on the time of day which can be confusing.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not good: Front desk staff too busy selling tours and add on’s to assist guests with checking in or out. Small lobby. No wireless or broadband in apartment and no desk.
reviews.title: A fantastic resort

aka: The Lakes Cairns Resort And Spa
